title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**MANDATORY SKILLS - APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT**

**EXPERIENCE -** At least 3 years of professional experience as a React Frontend Developer or senior JAVA developer.

· Expertise in React, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES 6+) for frontend development.

· Expertise in JAVA JDK 11/17+, Spring Boot v3.3.x+, Spring Cloud, Spring Security, Redis, SQL Server/Maria DB for backend development.

· Familiarity with common AMQP like: Rabbit MQ, IBMMQ, Kafka, Flink etc.

· Familiarity with modern front-end tools and libraries (Webpack, Babel, NPM, NodeJS etc.).

· Familiarity with version control systems (Git).

· Familiarity with automatically code compile and deployment (CI/CD).

· Familiarity with Agile Development model and know how to use JIRA or Open Project to manage the ticket tracking.

· Familiarity with common devOps tools (Docker, Kubernetes etc).

· Experience with Elasticsearch integration.

· Understanding of responsive design principles and techniques.

· Knowledge of state management libraries (e.g., Redux) and UI frameworks (e.g., Material-UI, Ant Design).

· Experience with GIS Map service development and Integration (Open Layer, Three.js, Arc GIS, OSM integration etc).

· Ability to write clean, maintainable, and scalable code.

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: $8,000.00 - $8,500.00 per month

Benefits:

* Health insurance

title: Software Engineer
description:
**SOFTWARE ENGINEER - LEVEL 2**

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a senior Full Stack developer to join our development team. As a key member, he/she will be responsible for designing and developing engaging and high-performance HTML5 web applications. His/her expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies will drive the creation of user-centric interfaces that enhance the overall user experience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Requirement Analysis: Assist the Project leader to analysis the user story, provide useful advice and the best implementation way.

· Develop User Interfaces: Design and develop responsive and interactive web applications using the React framework and Spring Boot framework.

· Good Code Quality: Self-quality control and delivery good quality program/function for the project.

· Code Optimization: Optimize JS and JAVA code for performance, scalability, and maintainability.

· Code Security/Safety: Provide security program without Vulnerability risk.

· Collaboration: Collaborate with project manager, UI/UX designers, and other developers to ensure seamless integration and a cohesive user experience.

· Problem-Solving: Identify and resolve technical issues and bugs in a timely manner.

· Documentation: Write clear, concise and readable technical documentation for code, APIs, function description, and project deliverables.

· Stay Current: Keep abreast of the latest trends and advancements in technologies and frameworks.

**Technical Requirements:**

· Expertise in React, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES 6+) for frontend development.

· Expertise in JAVA JDK 11/17+, Spring Boot v3.3.x+, Spring Cloud, Spring Security, Redis, SQL Server/Maria DB for backend development.

· Familiarity with common AMQP like: Rabbit MQ, IBMMQ, Kafka, Flink etc.

· Familiarity with modern front-end tools and libraries (Webpack, Babel, NPM, NodeJS etc.).

· Familiarity with version control systems (Git).

· Familiarity with automatically code compile and deployment (CI/CD).

· Familiarity with Agile Development model and know how to use JIRA or Open Project to manage the ticket tracking.

· Familiarity with common devOps tools (Docker, Kubernetes etc).

· Experience with Elasticsearch integration.

· Understanding of responsive design principles and techniques.

· Knowledge of state management libraries (e.g., Redux) and UI frameworks (e.g., Material-UI, Ant Design).

· Experience with GIS Map service development and Integration (Open Layer, Three.js, Arc GIS, OSM integration etc).

· Ability to write clean, maintainable, and scalable code.

**Soft Skills**

· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

· Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

· Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

· Willingness to learn and stay current with industry trends.

**Education and Experience:**

· Degree and above in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

· At least 3 years of professional experience as a React Frontend Developer or senior JAVA developer.

· Portfolio or GitLab profile showcasing relevant projects and contributions.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: $7,800.00 - $8,400.00 per month

Benefits:

* Health insurance

title: Automation Lab Engineer
description:
Intrinsic is Alphabet's bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what's possible for industrial robotics in the near future – with software and data at the core.

Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

**Role**
--------

As an Automation Lab Engineer, you will be a key member of our team in Singapore, bringing your passion for robotics and hands-on expertise to our lab. In this hands-on role, you will work with industrial and mobile robots, contributing to a cross-functional team that is pushing the boundaries of what's possible in robotics. As a senior member of the team, you will not only maintain and expand our lab's capabilities but also collaborate with partners globally and in the region to deploy and support our innovative robotic solutions.

**How your work moves the mission forward**
-------------------------------------------

* Conceptualize, design, and build complex robotic automation systems for platform testing and demonstration, playing a pivotal role in expanding the Singapore lab.
* Maintain the lab's critical infrastructure, including industrial and mobile robots, to ensure smooth research and development efforts.
* Collaborate closely with the global lab infrastructure team to establish and maintain best practices for lab operations, safety, and equipment management across different locations.
* Provide essential feedback to software developers and researchers for the continuous improvement and validation of the platform.
* Source and integrate the latest technologies into automation workcells.
* Collaborate with global and regional partners on the deployment, commissioning, and support of robotic systems in real-world applications.

**Skills you will need to be successful**
-----------------------------------------

* A Bachelor's degree in a mechatronics-related engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience with mechatronic systems, ideally within the automation industry.
* Some experience with the commissioning, troubleshooting, and programming of robots.
* A proven track record of managing and coordinating hardware bring-up projects and/or managing a lab environment.

**Skills that will differentiate your candidacy**
-------------------------------------------------

* Experience with designing electrical and pneumatic schematics for automation equipment, and the ability to assemble electrical panels.
* In-depth knowledge of robotic safety systems and standards.
* Experience with PLC programming and commissioning.
* Professional work experience with Python and/or C++.
* Broad exposure to various industries that utilize robotic automation, such as electronics, automotive, aerospace, or medical.
* Experience working directly with customers and partners in the APAC region.

At Intrinsic, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Employment at Intrinsic is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. Intrinsic does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Intrinsic's policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate-support@intrinsic.ai.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Simulation
description:
Intrinsic is Alphabet's bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what's possible for industrial robotics in the near future – with software and data at the core.

Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

**Role**
--------

As a Senior Software Engineer specializing in Simulation, you will apply your deep experience in robotics software and physics-based simulation to build high-fidelity environments using Gazebo. You will work closely with other software engineers, roboticists, and perception experts to create digital twins that enable the testing and validation of robotic software without the need for physical hardware. You will provide technical leadership within the team, driving the architecture and implementation of scalable simulation infrastructure to ensure our robotic solutions are robust and reliable for real-world industrial applications.

**How your work moves the mission forward**
-------------------------------------------

* Design and implement scalable simulation infrastructure and assets using Gazebo and ROS.
* Lead the technical approach for bridging the gap between simulation and real-world robot performance (sim-to-real).
* Develop automated testing workflows that leverage simulation for continuous integration and validation.
* Collaborate with product and engineering teams to integrate simulation capabilities into the Flowstate platform.
* Mentor junior engineers to foster technical growth and best practices in robotics simulation.
* Maintain and contribute to the development of open source software.

**Skills you will need to be successful**
-----------------------------------------

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or Robotics, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in robotics software development or simulation.
* Proficiency programming in C++ and Python.
* Experience building and optimizing large, multi-threaded systems.
* Extensive experience with the Gazebo simulator and ROS 2.
* Experience with building physics simulations using engines such as Dart, Bullet, ODE, or MuJoCo.

**Skills that will differentiate your candidacy**
-------------------------------------------------

* Experience with cloud infrastructure (e.g., GCP, Kubernetes) for running distributed simulations.
* Familiarity with Entity-Component-System (ECS) architecture for game or simulation development.
* Knowledge of computer graphics or rendering pipelines.
* Experience with sensor data or synthetic data generation.
* Experience with Universal Scene Description (USD), Simulation Description Format (SDF), and Unified Robotics Description Format (URDF).
* Background in developing plugins or core contributions to open-source robotics projects.
* Experience with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing.
* Experience creating interfaces for front end user facing tools.
* Willingness to travel domestically and internationally.

At Intrinsic, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Employment at Intrinsic is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. Intrinsic does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Intrinsic's policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate-support@intrinsic.ai.

title: Software Engineer, Simulation
description:
Intrinsic is Alphabet's bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what's possible for industrial robotics in the near future – with software and data at the core.

Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

**Role**
--------

As a Software Engineer specializing in Simulation, you will collaborate with senior engineers to build and maintain high-fidelity simulation environments using Gazebo. You will be responsible for implementing features, creating assets, and running validation tests to ensure our digital twins accurately reflect real-world physics and hardware. You will work closely with the simulation and robotics teams to support the development of the Flowstate platform, ensuring that our tools are reliable and efficient for internal and external developers.

**How your work moves the mission forward**
-------------------------------------------

* Develop and maintain simulation assets and environments using Gazebo and ROS.
* Implement software features that bridge the gap between simulation and physical robot behavior.
* Create and execute automated tests to validate robotic software performance in simulated environments.
* Collaborate with senior engineers to optimize simulation infrastructure for scalability and speed.
* Document technical workflows and contribute to the internal knowledge base for simulation tools.
* Maintain and contribute to the development of open source software.

**Skills you will need to be successful**
-----------------------------------------

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or Robotics, or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience in robotics software development or simulation.
* Proficiency programming in C++ and Python.
* Experience with the Gazebo simulator and ROS.
* Familiarity with physics engines (e.g., Dart, Bullet, ODE, MuJoCo).

**Skills that will differentiate your candidacy**
-------------------------------------------------

* Experience with Universal Scene Description (USD) and Simulation Description Format (SDF), and Unified Robotics Description Format (URDF).
* Familiarity with Entity-Component-System (ECS) architecture for game or simulation development.
* Knowledge of 3D modeling or computer graphics.
* Experience with sensor data or synthetic data generation
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP) for running automated tests or simulations.
* Background in developing plugins for open-source robotics projects.
* Experience working with version control systems and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience creating interfaces for front end user facing tools.
* Willingness to travel domestically and internationally.

At Intrinsic, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Employment at Intrinsic is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Intrinsic's policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate-support@intrinsic.ai.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Fullstack Engineer, who is developing our leading digital smart city platform. Apply your skills, knowledge and creativity to shape our cloud-based smart city platform with cutting edge frontend and backend solutions such as representation of very high-resolution panoramic images, 3D data visualization and complex analytic calculations.

**Who we are**

As the global leader in nature-based smart city solutions, we help cities around the world become greener and more resilient against climate change. We apply the latest remote sensing technologies and develop machine learning algorithms and software to automate the analysis of urban trees and green spaces. With our cloud-based platform, cities can improve the operational efficiency of green space management and strategic city planning to create a greener, healthier, safer, and more resilient urban environment. We currently have offices in Berlin, Paris, San Francisco, and Singapore, with production headquarters in Budapest.

**What you will be doing**

* Participating in our backend and frontend development efforts, where high-performance and speed play vital role
* Cooperate with our product team (UX, UI, Product management)
* Building and coding backend in Node.JS, frontend in React in a complex web application.
* Participating in/ conducting code reviews.
* Providing robust and stable code, applying performance tests.
* Providing professional guidance for less experienced developers according to seniority level.
* Having ownership of our backend and frontend code with freedom of innovation.

**What you should have**

* 3+ years of experience in Node.JS and/or React.
* Strong JavaScript and/or TypeScript knowledge.
* Experience in GitHub and CI/CD flows.
* Proven track record of implementing high-performance systems
* Expertise in building scalable applications, while considering security aspects.
* High-performing professionals who take ownership and have a can-do & self-starter attitude.
* Fluency in English (written and oral)

title: Internship - UI/UX Developer, Singapore (July to December 2026)
description:
**Help us get ahead of disease together** **with our UI/UX Developer Internship, 2026:**

**Education required:** Undergraduates studying Bachelor’s Degree in an accredited university, from disciplines including Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science and Analytics or any other relevant courses

**Other requirements:** Must be enrolled at a SG university for the duration of your internship and doing a full-time credit-bearing internship

**Language requirement:** Written and spoken fluency in English

**Internship period**: July to December 2026

**Application deadline:** As applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, we recommend applying as soon as possible for your application to be considered. This vacancy will be closed once we have enough applications for consideration.

Are you looking to gain valuable world work experience and help to positively impact the health of billions of people? Apply for a GSK Internship today!

**What will you do?**

As a UI/UX Developer Intern at GSK, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the UI/UX of an in-house data science platform. This platform translates complex pharmaceutical manufacturing data into actionable insights, enabling us to diagnose issues and identify opportunities for process optimisation. You will collaborate closely with our development team, users, and other stakeholders to identify areas for improvement and implement effective solutions to enhance the usability and accessibility of the platform.

**Responsibilities**

* Design and implement improvements to the platform's interface and user experience, aligning with the overall product direction
* Develop and present design concepts using tools such as mock-ups, sitemaps, process flows, and storyboards
* Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with the development team
* Conduct usability testing and refine designs based on user feedback to ensure an intuitive and user-friendly experience
* Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards that emphasise simplicity and user-friendliness

**What will you learn?**

* Develop your skills in UI/UX design and frontend development by creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces and processes. You will also have the opportunity to gain exposure to data analytics and machine learning.
* Learn about the pharmaceutical industry and the crucial role it plays in improving global healthcare outcomes. You'll contribute to GSK's vision of reaching 2.5 billion patients annually.
* Develop a variety of soft skills essential for workplace success. You'll engage with users and stakeholders effectively, collaborate within a team, and pick up project management skills that will benefit your future career.

**What are we looking for?**

* A proven track record of applying user-first design principles, as demonstrated in your portfolio
* Proficiency in JavaScript or jQuery. Additional experience with other libraries and frameworks such as TypeScript, Angular, and Svelte is a big plus
* Proficiency in HTML and CSS
* Experience with Python, SQL and Git
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proficiency in English
* A strong advocate for user-centred design principles and best practices
* Excellent visual design skills, with a keen eye for user-system interaction and a passion for creating performant, visually appealing layouts
* Strong analytical skills and a knack for troubleshooting and creative problem-solving

**What do we offer you?**

* Understand and experience the GSK Culture
* Work with a diversified team of professionals
* Implement technical knowledge and skills that you have acquired at school
* Apply and develop soft skills such as interpersonal, communications and negotiation skills

**Let’s do this!**

You’ll find hints, tips and guidance on our recruitment process on our website.

Learn more about the application process: gsk.to/ETprocess

Hear more from our past interns here: GSK Internship Experience

Get some tips from our interns: Top Tips from Our Interns

You can learn more about GSK and our careers here https://www.gsk.com/en-gb/careers/

**Apply now!**

***Need help with your application?***

*Please email us at* apac.earlycareers@gsk.com *and let us know how we can help you.*

#GSKSingapore #SGInternship #EarlyCareers

**Why GSK?**

**Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.**

GSK is a global biopharma company with a purpose to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. We aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade, as a successful, growing company where people can thrive. We get ahead of disease by preventing and treating it with innovation in specialty medicines and vaccines. We focus on four therapeutic areas: respiratory, immunology and inflammation; oncology; HIV; and infectious diseases – to impact health at scale.

People and patients around the world count on the medicines and vaccines we make, so we’re committed to creating an environment where our people can thrive and focus on what matters most. Our culture of being ambitious for patients, accountable for impact and doing the right thing is the foundation for how, together, we deliver for patients, shareholders and our people.

We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and providing equal opportunities for all applicants. We embrace an agile working culture across our roles, so if flexibility is important to you please discuss opportunities with our hiring team. If you need any adjustments to the recruitment process to help you demonstrate your strengths and capabilities, contact APACRecruitment.Adjustments@gsk.com. Please note this email is for adjustment requests only; for other enquiries please use our standard contact channels.

**Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies**

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**Responsibilities:**

Collaborate with sales and software engineering teams to evaluate, identify, provide pricing for optimal cloud solutions for customers for Anacle's software solutions

Lead and mentor a team of cloud engineers and security engineers on operations, and security-related audits

Provide advice to and lead meetings with customers on cloud architecture design for Anacle's software solutions

Plan, design cloud infrastructure, oversee and be involved with the implementation of a cloud architecture necessary to support Anacle's software applications

Plan, design cloud infrastructure, oversee and be involved with the implementation of alerts, monitoring, regular review and other necessary tools and processes on cloud architectures to ensure security, availability, and optimal performance

Plan and oversee vulnerability / security updates and firmware patches.

Plan and oversee statuses of backups and perform disaster recovery when required.

Respond to cloud infrastructure-related incidents (related security, availability, performance) on time

Provide support during annual cloud security audits

**Essential Skills and Experience:**

At least a Bachelor’s Degree, Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent.

Experience with cloud technologies – AWS, Azure, Google Cloud or Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

At least 4 years of relevant working experience

Good background in Operating System administration for Linux/Unix and/or Microsoft Windows Server.

Proficient in networking concepts (e.g., DNS, TCP/IP, and firewalls)

Good knowledge of industry standard security compliance standards such as ISO 27001 and SOC 2

Hands-on experience in managing public cloud including developing and deploying large, scalable production applications on cloud/IaaSs, PaaS platforms and Containers; knowledge with Docker and Kubernetes; knowledge with Infrastructure-as-Code is a plus.

Working knowledge of DevOps software development tools and methodologies is a plus.

Cloud service providers’ certification will be a plus

Able to work after office hours depending on project needs

Able to handle multiple tasks and priorities using effective organisational and time management skills.

Able to take ownership of tasks, and demonstrates strong leadership qualities

A good team player who is able to work in a fast-paced environment.

**We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.**

### **Key Details**

Role: Cloud Architect

Location: Singapore

Category: Engineering

Employment Type: Full-Time

title: Intern, Software Development Engineer [COO-ESE]
description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD94026

Position Overview

Autodesk Engineering Operations team is seeking a passionate Software Engineering (DevOps) Intern to enhance our operations throughput with intelligent automation. This is a great opportunity to:

* Create amazing things and learn from some of the best in the industry

* Experiment, learn, and grow

* Use the latest and greatest cloud & AI technologies

* Mentor and be mentored

Our team empowers & strives to keep the wheels of business turning, foster seamless collaboration, and continuously improve our processes, enabling our partners to focus on delivering value to customers and shaping a better world through technology.

You will join a team developing and analyzing trends to turn into intelligent AI powered experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Based on the trends, docs formalize a criterion to identify scopes fit for AI powered workflows in CI/CD, Build and Release areas

* Design, develop, test features and functionalities via applications and services

* Analyze data extracted from the tools to visualize the benchmarks and anomalies

* Write code that is tested, readable, and maintainable

* Engage in technical and architectural discussions and decision making

* Assisting with data pipeline enhancements for better ingestion performance and reliability.

* Collaborate with senior engineers to build dashboards and insights that provide actionable metrics for power consumption and system performance.

* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements, understand use cases and build towards a cohesive technical strategy

* Automate intelligent processes where possible and propose new tools/workflows when needed

Minimum Qualifications:

* You must be enrolled in a full-time bachelor's Program in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or other relevant fields
* You must either be in your penultimate or final year of studies, and will be graduating in 2026 or 2027
* Internship period: June – December 2026, 6 months full-time internship only

Preferred Qualifications:

* Hands-on software development experience, Python preferred

* Familiar with cloud-native applications

* Familiar with Relational and NoSQL database technologies

* Customer-facing and service-oriented person

* Understanding DevOps. SRE best practices, architectures, and methods

* Ability to work in a remote team environment and successfully build collaborative relationships

Learning Benefits:

Exposure to modern software practices such as:

* Agile Methodologies

* Test driven development

* Business driven development

* Understanding DevOps. SRE best practices, architectures, and methods

* Exposure to Continuous Integration and Deployment tools

About Autodesk  
  
At Autodesk, we help innovators bring ideas to life—from sustainable buildings and smart factories to blockbuster movies and next-generation cars. Our software empowers creators to reimagine what’s possible and make it real. We’re proud of our culture, which guides how we work, connect, and grow together. Here, you can do meaningful work that shapes a better world for all.

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – it’s at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience, educational level, and geographic location.

Diversity & Belonging  
We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here:

https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

title: Software Development Engineer - Web SDK
description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD93816

Position Overview

Autodesk Identity & Access Management (IAM) team is seeking a skilled and highly motivated individual who loves to find and develop efficient, thoughtful solutions to various technical and product challenges.In this role, you will help develop and expand Autodesk's Identity WebSDK, a critical component that standardizes how web applications integrate with our Identity services.

This SDK is widely used internally and is evolving to support Autodesk's growing 3rd-party developer ecosystem, enabling seamless and secure integrations at scale. Our mission is to adopt a developer-first approach by building a reliable and scalable SDK that provides a seamless integration experience for both Autodesk teams and third-party developers. As a team member, you will collaborate with senior engineers and the product manager to design, develop, and deliver features that improve the SDK's reliability and developer experience, enabling products and services to support millions of Autodesk customers daily.

What You'll Do

* Work effectively as a member of the self-organized agile team to design, build, and enhance Autodesk's Identity Web SDK
* Contribute to all aspects of development, including DevOps and quality

improvements

* Develop and maintain reliable, developer-friendly components that integrate

seamlessly with Autodesk's Identity platform

* Work closely with senior engineers and product managers to understand

requirements and translate them into elegant implementations

* Assist with troubleshooting, logging, and reliability improvements to ensure the SDK meets enterprise-scale standards
* Use overall ecosystem understanding to identify opportunities for continuous

improvement of the scalability, reliability, usability, and security of the SDK

Minimum Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science
* 0-3 years of software engineering experience
* Solid analysis and critical thinking
* Strong knowledge and hands on experience in

o At least one of the following programming languages: JavaScript,

TypeScript

o Modern frontend builds tools such as Webpack, Babel, and NPM

* Familiar with HTML, CSS
* Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
* Understanding of REST APIs and how to integrate them with web applications
* Committed to quality, including security and performance
* Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
* Excellent grasp of basic tenets of computer programming

Preferred Qualifications

* Exposure to frontend frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue
* Curiosity and enthusiasm for frontend development and SDK design.
* Familiarity with performance monitoring for web applications
* Experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest) or automation tools is a plus.
* Familiarity with basic authentication flows is a plus
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices is a plus.

Ideal Candidate

* Eager to learn and adopt new technologies quickly in a collaborative

environment

* Adaptable, self-motivated, and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership over your work.
* Passionate about building developer-friendly tools that are reliable, scalable,

and easy to use

* Comfortable troubleshooting and debugging technical issues methodical

Entry-level Professional role  

* Require basic knowledge of and exposure to fundamental theories, principles, and concepts within a specific discipline – typically gained through formal education or equivalent training
* Require little or no prior work experience
* Perform routine, defined assignments with direct guidance and oversight from others with more experience
* Learn to use professional concepts in practical situations through completion of work assignments and training
* Take an active role in learning and becoming familiar with the discipline and broader team environment
* Typically seek guidance on problems as they arise, and adapt to solve problems encountered previously

  
#LI-AA1

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – it’s at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

title: Software Development Engineer - Web SDK
description:
Position Overview

Autodesk Identity & Access Management (IAM) team is seeking a skilled and highly motivated individual who loves to find and develop efficient, thoughtful solutions to various technical and product challenges.In this role, you will help develop and expand Autodesk's Identity WebSDK, a critical component that standardizes how web applications integrate with our Identity services.

This SDK is widely used internally and is evolving to support Autodesk's growing 3rd-party developer ecosystem, enabling seamless and secure integrations at scale. Our mission is to adopt a developer-first approach by building a reliable and scalable SDK that provides a seamless integration experience for both Autodesk teams and third-party developers. As a team member, you will collaborate with senior engineers and the product manager to design, develop, and deliver features that improve the SDK's reliability and developer experience, enabling products and services to support millions of Autodesk customers daily.

What You'll Do

* Work effectively as a member of the self-organized agile team to design, build, and enhance Autodesk's Identity Web SDK
* Contribute to all aspects of development, including DevOps and quality

improvements

* Develop and maintain reliable, developer-friendly components that integrate

seamlessly with Autodesk's Identity platform

* Work closely with senior engineers and product managers to understand

requirements and translate them into elegant implementations

* Assist with troubleshooting, logging, and reliability improvements to ensure the SDK meets enterprise-scale standards
* Use overall ecosystem understanding to identify opportunities for continuous

improvement of the scalability, reliability, usability, and security of the SDK

Minimum Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science
* 0-3 years of software engineering experience
* Solid analysis and critical thinking
* Strong knowledge and hands on experience in

o At least one of the following programming languages: JavaScript,

TypeScript

o Modern frontend builds tools such as Webpack, Babel, and NPM

* Familiar with HTML, CSS
* Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
* Understanding of REST APIs and how to integrate them with web applications
* Committed to quality, including security and performance
* Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
* Excellent grasp of basic tenets of computer programming

Preferred Qualifications

* Exposure to frontend frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue
* Curiosity and enthusiasm for frontend development and SDK design.
* Familiarity with performance monitoring for web applications
* Experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest) or automation tools is a plus.
* Familiarity with basic authentication flows is a plus
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices is a plus.

Ideal Candidate

* Eager to learn and adopt new technologies quickly in a collaborative

environment

* Adaptable, self-motivated, and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership over your work.
* Passionate about building developer-friendly tools that are reliable, scalable,

and easy to use

* Comfortable troubleshooting and debugging technical issues methodical

Entry-level Professional role  

* Require basic knowledge of and exposure to fundamental theories, principles, and concepts within a specific discipline – typically gained through formal education or equivalent training
* Require little or no prior work experience
* Perform routine, defined assignments with direct guidance and oversight from others with more experience
* Learn to use professional concepts in practical situations through completion of work assignments and training
* Take an active role in learning and becoming familiar with the discipline and broader team environment
* Typically seek guidance on problems as they arise, and adapt to solve problems encountered previously

  
#LI-AA1

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Autodesk has always valued flexibility in how we work. We continue to provide employees flexibility to support their work preferences wherever possible and nearly all roles are hybrid or remote, unless otherwise indicated.

title: Intern, Software Development Engineer [PSET-Access-ENG]
description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD94013

Position Overview  
  
Join Autodesk's Identity Services team, where we build secure, scalable authentication and authorization solutions that power all Autodesk products and cloud services. As we scale our next-generation Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) platform, we're seeking a motivated intern to help tackle real-world challenges and contribute to meaningful improvements across our authorization service.

Responsibilities:  
  
As a Software Engineering Intern on the Authorization team, you will:

* Tackle real-world challenges across multiple projects that directly impact how our authorization service operates and gets consumed by Autodesk's product ecosystem
* Drive meaningful improvements to service reliability, developer experience, operational efficiency, and platform capabilities
* Collaborate on high-impact initiatives ranging from tooling automation and monitoring enhancements to service optimization and client integration improvements
* Contribute to solving actual production problems while gaining hands-on experience with enterprise-scale authorization systems
* Participate in a symbiotic learning environment where your fresh perspective and academic knowledge help us approach problems innovatively, while you gain practical experience with real-world software engineering challenges
* Work alongside senior engineers on architecture decisions, troubleshooting complex issues, and implementing solutions that serve millions of users

Minimum Qualifications:

* Currently enrolled full-time in a Bachelor's program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field
* You must either be in your penultimate or final year of studies, and will be graduating in 2026 or 2027
* Available for internship: June - December 2026, 6 months full-time only
* Strong programming fundamentals in at least one modern language (Java, Python, Go)

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience with AWS cloud platform
* Knowledge of authentication and authorization concepts (OAuth, JWT, etc.)
* Experience using MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers

Learning Benefits:

* Enterprise software development practices including CI/CD, testing strategies, and production deployment
* Identity and security domain expertise in authentication, authorization, and compliance
* Platform engineering skills including observability, monitoring, and performance optimization
* Cloud-native architecture patterns and scalability principles
* Cross-functional collaboration with product managers, designers, and senior engineers

Why Join Us?

* Work on systems that directly impact millions of Autodesk users worldwide
* Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge identity and security technologies
* Mentorship from senior engineers and exposure to architectural decision-making

About Autodesk  
At Autodesk, we help innovators bring ideas to life—from sustainable buildings and smart factories to blockbuster movies and next-generation cars. Our software empowers creators to reimagine what’s possible and make it real. We’re proud of our culture, which guides how we work, connect, and grow together. Here, you can do meaningful work that shapes a better world for all.  
  
#LI-AA1

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – it’s at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience, educational level, and geographic location.

title: Internship - UI/UX Developer, Singapore (July to December 2026)
description:
**Help us get ahead of disease together** **with our UI/UX Developer Internship, 2026:**

**Education required:** Undergraduates studying Bachelor’s Degree in an accredited university, from disciplines including Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science and Analytics or any other relevant courses

**Other requirements:** Must be enrolled at a SG university for the duration of your internship and doing a full-time credit-bearing internship

**Language requirement:** Written and spoken fluency in English

**Internship period** : July to December 2026

**Application deadline:** As applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, we recommend applying as soon as possible for your application to be considered. This vacancy will be closed once we have enough applications for consideration.

Are you looking to gain valuable world work experience and help to positively impact the health of billions of people? Apply for a GSK Internship today!

**What will you do?**

As a UI/UX Developer Intern at GSK, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the UI/UX of an in-house data science platform. This platform translates complex pharmaceutical manufacturing data into actionable insights, enabling us to diagnose issues and identify opportunities for process optimisation. You will collaborate closely with our development team, users, and other stakeholders to identify areas for improvement and implement effective solutions to enhance the usability and accessibility of the platform.

**Responsibilities**

* Design and implement improvements to the platform's interface and user experience, aligning with the overall product direction
* Develop and present design concepts using tools such as mock-ups, sitemaps, process flows, and storyboards
* Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with the development team
* Conduct usability testing and refine designs based on user feedback to ensure an intuitive and user-friendly experience
* Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards that emphasise simplicity and user-friendliness

**What will you learn?**

* Develop your skills in UI/UX design and frontend development by creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces and processes. You will also have the opportunity to gain exposure to data analytics and machine learning.
* Learn about the pharmaceutical industry and the crucial role it plays in improving global healthcare outcomes. You'll contribute to GSK's vision of reaching 2.5 billion patients annually.
* Develop a variety of soft skills essential for workplace success. You'll engage with users and stakeholders effectively, collaborate within a team, and pick up project management skills that will benefit your future career.

**What are we looking for?**

* A proven track record of applying user-first design principles, as demonstrated in your portfolio
* Proficiency in JavaScript or jQuery. Additional experience with other libraries and frameworks such as TypeScript, Angular, and Svelte is a big plus
* Proficiency in HTML and CSS
* Experience with Python, SQL and Git
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proficiency in English
* A strong advocate for user-centred design principles and best practices
* Excellent visual design skills, with a keen eye for user-system interaction and a passion for creating performant, visually appealing layouts
* Strong analytical skills and a knack for troubleshooting and creative problem-solving

**What do we offer you?**

* Understand and experience the GSK Culture
* Work with a diversified team of professionals
* Implement technical knowledge and skills that you have acquired at school
* Apply and develop soft skills such as interpersonal, communications and negotiation skills

**Let’s do this!**

You’ll find hints, tips and guidance on our recruitment process on our website.

Learn more about the application process: gsk.to/ETprocess

Hear more from our past interns here: GSK Internship Experience

Get some tips from our interns: Top Tips from Our Interns

You can learn more about GSK and our careers here https://www.gsk.com/en-gb/careers/

**Apply now!**

***Need help with your application?***

*Please email us at* apac.earlycareers@gsk.com *and let us know how we can help you.*

#GSKSingapore #SGInternship #EarlyCareers

**Why GSK?**

**Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.**

GSK is a global biopharma company with a purpose to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. We aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade, as a successful, growing company where people can thrive. We get ahead of disease by preventing and treating it with innovation in specialty medicines and vaccines. We focus on four therapeutic areas: respiratory, immunology and inflammation; oncology; HIV; and infectious diseases – to impact health at scale.

People and patients around the world count on the medicines and vaccines we make, so we’re committed to creating an environment where our people can thrive and focus on what matters most. Our culture of being ambitious for patients, accountable for impact and doing the right thing is the foundation for how, together, we deliver for patients, shareholders and our people.

We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and providing equal opportunities for all applicants. We embrace an agile working culture across our roles, so if flexibility is important to you please discuss opportunities with our hiring team. If you need any adjustments to the recruitment process to help you demonstrate your strengths and capabilities, contact APACRecruitment.Adjustments@gsk.com . Please note this email is for adjustment requests only; for other enquiries please use our standard contact channels.

**Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies**

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Software Engineering Intern
description:
Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales is a global technology leader trusted by governments, institutions, and enterprises to tackle their most demanding challenges. From quantum applications and artificial intelligence to cybersecurity and 6G innovation, our solutions empower critical decisions rooted in human intelligence. Operating at the forefront of aerospace and space, cybersecurity and digital identity, we’re driven by a mission to build a future we can all trust.

In Singapore, Thales has been a trusted partner since 1973, originally focused on aerospace activities in the Asia-Pacific region. With 2,000 employees across three local sites, we deliver cutting-edge solutions across aerospace (including air traffic management), defence and security, and digital identity and cybersecurity sectors. Together, we’re shaping the future by enabling customers to make pivotal decisions that safeguard communities and power progress.

As an intern at AIR Lab, you will support the development of advanced ATM capabilities—such as data processing, system modelling, user interfaces for controllers, or machine-learning modules for sustainable flight operations. You will work in a collaborative, multidisciplinary environment, gaining exposure to aviation R&D, real-world integration challenges, and the conceptualization of future air-traffic infrastructure.  
You are eager to dive deep into technical challenges, identify solutions, and effectively communicate your findings, helping the team learn and grow. You are enthusiastic about exploring new technologies and finding innovative ways to apply your knowledge.

**Responsibilities:**  

* Collaborate with the team to identify, design, implement or test one or more modules (software, algorithm, UI, prototype) in line with AIR Lab’s mission.
* Participate in requirements gathering, system architecture discussions, or user-interaction design as relevant.
* Develop code, scripts or models (e.g., for simulation, data-ingestion, analytics, UI behaviour) under guidance.
* Assist with data collection, cleaning and analysis (e.g., flight-trajectory, radar, ADS-B data sets).
* Test and validate prototypes or simulations: document findings, issues and improvement suggestions.
* Present results to the team and propose next-step contributions.

What You’ll Gain  

* Hands-on exposure to Air Traffic Management R&D and sustainable aviation systems.
* Experience working within a joint innovation lab backed by CAAS & Thales, with access to real aviation-industry challenges.
* Mentorship from industry and research engineers; opportunities to contribute to live proofs-of-concept.
* Strengthened professional portfolio in software/systems/AI in aviation context.
* Potential for further opportunities within AIR Lab or in the Thales Group.

**Education**  

* Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Diploma, Bachelor’s or Master’s programme in Computer Science, Software/Systems Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Data Science/Analytics, Human-Computer Interaction or related fields.

Desirable Skills  

* Good programming experience (e.g., Python, Java, C++), or experience with ML/AI frameworks (depending on the role).
* Solid analytical skills, able to handle data sets, simulation environments or system-level thinking.
* Interest in aviation, air traffic management, sustainable operation or emerging architectures is a plus.
* Good communication skills; ability to work in a multidisciplinary team.
* Self-starter attitude, willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-moving R&D environment.
* Eligibility to intern in Singapore (work permit, etc) as required.

At Thales, we’re committed to fostering a workplace where respect, trust, collaboration, and passion drive everything we do. Here, you’ll feel empowered to bring your best self, thrive in a supportive culture, and love the work you do. Join us, and be part of a team reimagining technology to create solutions that truly make a difference – for a safer, greener, and more inclusive world.
company_description: From aerospace, space and defence to security and transportation, Thales helps its customers to build a safer, greener, more inclusive future we can all trust.

title: Network Engineer, Google Cloud (Mandarin, English)
description:
Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.

### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 3 years of experience in networking with both physical network devices and overlaying virtual networks.
* Experience in testing, and launching networking software products.
* Experience in network design and trouble shooting of network deployments.
* Ability to communicate in Mandarin and English fluently to partner with local clients and regional partners.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience in working with large-scale distributed systems and related network infrastructure.
* Experience with cloud technologies, such as Google Cloud Platform.
* Experience running high growth production workloads or production services at scale.
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate with customers and influence partners.
* Excellent problem-solving and investigative skills.

**About the job**
-----------------

Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
  
  
Cloud Networking is an engineering team responsible for the development of Google Cloud Platform's networking infrastructure, tools and products.
  
  
This team is part of the Cloud Networking and their role specializes in network diagnostics, troubleshooting, performance measurement and benchmarking.
  
  
In this role, you will be involved in onboarding very high value customers, where Google needs performance benchmarking to provide guidance to the user when they have extreme network throughput and processing requirements.  
  
You will have a unique opportunity to master Google's planet-scale network and develop critical insights to Fortune 500 workloads on Google Cloud. You will have a front-row seat to innovation, observing how advanced networking capabilities are woven into the cloud of the future, the very infrastructure that will unlock the next generation of AI-driven, hyper-scale applications.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Work with other engineers to troubleshoot and resolve network issues.
* Build network specific expertise in the team and serve as an expert, provide consultation to other engineering and support teams working in cloud networking areas. Analyze common problems, isolating problem areas and build long term solutions for addressing the same.
* Stay up-to-date on the latest cloud networking technologies and trends. Provide technical leadership on key projects help in onboarding customers.
* Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity. Improve visibility into the network performance, availability and traffic patterns via metrics, alerting and engineering analysis.
* Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health. Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
Singapore

Information Technology (IT)

Group Functions

**Job Reference #**

320592BR

**City**

Singapore

**Job Type**

Full Time

**Your role**

Join our agile team of software engineers delivering software with the latest technology standards. You will:  

* design and implement new, highly scalable system capabilities centered around Java-based APIs, React applications, and cutting-edge web components
* engineer streamlined solutions that reduce complexity, address technical debt, and support cloud adoption
* enhance our DevOps landscape through the development of highly automated quality assurance, build, and deployment toolchains
* translate business requirements, both functional and non-functional, into robust, well-documented solution designs
* drive excellence and challenge the status quo by proactively contributing ideas and engaging in open communication with stakeholders across all levels

**Your team**

Our services contribute to UBS Wealth Management, Personal and Corporate banking businesses with a wide range of investment products tailored to clients across various geographies and all segments. We enable digitalization and globalization of our industry, leading wealth management business.  
You'll be working in the global Quotes team for the Instruments and Markets crew agile distributed team delivering a diverse portfolio of applications that provide e-banking clients as well as client advisors, with access to comprehensive real-time information of products and market data. Our culturally diverse team is based in Zurich, Singapore, and India.

**Your expertise**

* 5 years of experience in JavaScript, TypeScript, and React, with a strong grasp of web components

* familiarity with Redux and middleware technologies such as Thunk and Saga are a plus

* proactive, curious, and inquisitive mindset, with excellent communication skills necessary to convey technical ideas effectively and challenge conventional approaches

**About us**

UBS is a leading and truly global wealth manager and the leading universal bank in Switzerland. We also provide diversified asset management solutions and focused investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, UBS is present in more than 50 markets around the globe.  
We know that great work is never done alone. That’s why we place collaboration at the heart of everything we do. Because together, we’re more than ourselves. Want to find out more? Visit ubs.com/careers.

We may request you to complete one or more assessments during the application process. Learn more

At UBS, we know that it's our people, with their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds, who drive our ongoing success. We’re dedicated to our craft and passionate about putting our people first, with new challenges, a supportive team, opportunities to grow and flexible working options when possible. Our inclusive culture brings out the best in our employees, wherever they are on their career journey. And we use artificial intelligence (AI) to work smarter and more efficiently. We also recognize that great work is never done alone. That’s why collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Because together, we’re more than ourselves.  
We’re committed to disability inclusion and if you need reasonable accommodation/adjustments throughout our recruitment process, you can always contact us.

UBS Business Solutions SA  
UBS Recruiting

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Senior/ Software Engineer (C++, Java) - PS
description:
Job ID: 17237

Location:
Digital Hub, SG

Description:

**About ST Engineering**

ST Engineering is a global technology, defence, and engineering group with offices across Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the U.S., serving customers in more than 100 countries. The Group uses technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives through its diverse portfolio of businesses across the aerospace, smart city, defence, and public security segments. Headquartered in Singapore, ST Engineering ranks among the largest companies listed on the Singapore Exchange.

Our history spans more than 50 years, and our strategy is underpinned by our core values – Integrity, Value Creation, Courage, Commitment and Compassion. These 5 core values guide every aspect of our business and are embedded in our ST Engineering culture – from the people we hire, to working with each other, to our partners and customers.

  

**About our Line of Business – Mission Software & Services**

Our Mission Software & Services business provides leading-edge mission critical command, control, and communications (C3) systems with secured IT infrastructure and managed services. We support our client’s innovation journey through design thinking, analytics, and AI-enabled decision support with our full suite of cloud computing solutions. We provide intelligent, actionable insights and sustainable solutions to our valued partners in diverse industries including defence, government, and commercial sectors.

  

**Together, We Can Make A Significant Impact**

Join us in the journey of a global software service provider and step into the role of a crucial Software Developer; to design, develop, test and enhance mission-critical software and systems. You are empowered to shape the future and drive technological advancement in the Defence and Public Security sector across Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the U.S., serving customers in more than 100 countries. Dive into the intricacies of implementing, integrating, and troubleshooting software applications, ensuring they meet and exceed expectations. Your dedication to problem-solving and analytical skills will drive our innovative projects forward, while maintaining stringent compliance and documentation standards.

  

**Be Part of Our Success**

* Support the Lead in guiding the team in scrum process/task, Engaging with users and customers
* Build efficient software programs and systems that meet users needs
* To support new software enhancement and system configurations

* Programming well-designed, testable and efficient code that meets Software Quality Assurance standards
* Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility
* Integrate software components into a fully functional software system

* Document and maintain software functionality
* Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems
* Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting

* Perform validation and verification testing
* Conduct user acceptance tests and External System Integration tests
* Deploy Software applications and evaluate user feedback

  

**Qualities We Value**

* Familiar with Agile development, ReactJS, NodeJS, MongoDB, Flutter, Javascript/Typescript/FeatherJS, Java, Springboot, Git

* Familiar with DevOps is value added
* Must be hands-on and enjoys programming.
* Ability to learn new languages and technologies.

* Able to work independently and self-motivated.
* Good communication and documentation skills.
* Strong customer-service oriented and possess Can-Do attitude.

* Able to give guidance to team member
* Prefer 4 years experience and above

  

**Our Commitment That Goes Beyond the Norm**

* An environment where you will be working on cutting-edge technologies and architectures.
* Safe space where diverse perspectives are valued, and everyone’s unique contributions are celebrated.
